question_text: A fruit basket contains different types of fruits as shown in the table below.  Fruits in a Basket  | Fruit   | Number | |---------|--------| | Apples  | 15     | | Bananas | 25     | | Oranges | 10     | | Total   | 50     |  If a fruit is chosen at random from the basket, what is the probability that the fruit will be an apple?
subject: Math

question_text: #### Student Activities at a High School  |                        |    | Takes an Advanced Class   | Does Not Take an Advanced Class   | Total | |------------------------|----|---------------------------|-----------------------------------|-------| | Participates in a Club or Sport     | 70 | 30                        | 100                     | | Does Not Participate in a Club or Sport | 40 | 30                        | 70                      | | Total                  | 110| 60                        | 170                     |  At a high school, 170 students were surveyed about their participation in clubs or sports and whether they take advanced classes. The table above summarizes the results. Based on the data in the table, what is the probability that a student selected at random from those surveyed participates in a club or sport?
subject: Math

question_text: Types of Fruits Sold in June  | Market          | Month | Apples | Bananas | Oranges | |-----------------|-------|--------|---------|---------| | Green Valley    | June  | 60     | 45      | 30      | | Sunny Orchard   | June  | 40     | 55      | 70      |  The table above shows the number of different types of fruits sold at two farmers markets in June. Of the fruits sold in June, which of the following represents the fraction of fruits that were sold at Sunny Orchard Market?
subject: Math

question_text: A survey was conducted at Northwood High School to determine students' favorite subjects. The frequency table below shows the number of students who prefer each subject among 60 students surveyed. If a student from this survey is selected at random, what is the probability that their favorite subject is Science?
subject: Math

question_text: A survey of 600 people at a library asked whether they prefer to read ebooks or physical books. The table below summarizes all 600 responses from the people surveyed.  |                            | Adults | Teenagers | |----------------------------|--------|-----------| | Prefer to read ebooks      | 180    | 130       | | Prefer to read physical books |        | 90        |  If there were a total of 220 teenagers surveyed, how many of the adults surveyed responded that they prefer to read physical books?
subject: Math

question_text: A basket of 50 fruits contains apples, bananas, and oranges, as shown in the frequency table.  | Fruit     | Frequency | |-----------|-----------| | Apples    | 15        | | Bananas   | 25        | | Oranges   | 10        |  If one fruit is selected at random from the basket, what is the probability of selecting a banana?
subject: Math

question_text: A classroom has 25 students.  Of these students, 15 are taking a math class. If a student is selected at random from the classroom, what is the probability that the selected student is taking a math class?
subject: Math

question_text: A local animal shelter recorded data on the types of animals adopted and the age group of the adopters. The data is summarized in the table below.  | Adopter Age Group | Cat | Dog | Other Pet | Total | |---------------------|-----|-----|-----------|-------| | Adult (18-55)       | 125 | 150 | 25        | 300   | | Senior (55+)        | 75  | 50  | 75        | 200   | | Total               | 200 | 200 | 100       | 500   |  If one of the 500 adoptions recorded is selected at random, what is the probability that the adopted animal was a dog?
subject: Math

question_text: A bakery produced 800 bagels one morning, and during quality control, it was found that 6 bagels were burnt. If a bagel is randomly selected from this batch, what is the probability that it is burnt?
subject: Math

question_text: A fruit basket contains $m$ red apples and 20 green apples. If one apple is selected at random from the basket, what is the probability of selecting a red apple, in terms of $m$?
subject: Math

question_text: At Lakeside High School, the probability that a randomly selected student is a sophomore (10th grade) is 0.4. If there are 150 students in the school, how many students are sophomores?
subject: Math

question_text: A classroom has 30 students. Of these students, 18 are taking Spanish, and the rest are taking French. If a student is selected at random from this classroom, what is the probability that the selected student is taking French?
subject: Math

question_text: A student has a collection of markers. The collection includes 5 permanent markers, 3 dry-erase markers, and 2 highlighters. If one marker is selected at random from the collection, what is the probability of selecting a dry-erase marker?
subject: Math

question_text: Enrollment in After-School Activities by Grade Level  | Grade Level | Enrolled in Sports | Enrolled in Clubs | Total | |-------------|--------------------|-------------------|-------| | 9th         | 10                 | 8                 | 18    | | 10th        | 12                 | 5                 | 17    | | Total       | 22                 | 13                | 35    |  The table above shows the enrollment of 9th and 10th grade students in after-school activities at a high school. If one student is selected at random from these 35 students, what is the probability that the student selected will be a 10th grade student enrolled in Clubs?
subject: Math

question_text: A survey was conducted at a local coffee shop to understand customer preferences for pastry type and coffee temperature. The results for 150 customers are summarized in the table below.  |                 |                 |                    |      | |-----------------|-----------------|--------------------|------| |                 |                 | Coffee Temperature |      | |                 |                 | Hot    Iced   Total |      | | Pastry Type     | Muffin          | 42     28    70   |      | |                 | Croissant       | 33     47    80   |      | |                 | Total           | 75     75    150  |      |  What fraction of customers who prefer croissants also prefer iced coffee?
subject: Math

question_text: The table below shows the number of students at a high school who participate in after-school clubs and sports.  |                                  | Participates in a sport | Does not participate in a sport | |----------------------------------|------------------------|---------------------------------| | Participates in a club           | 15                     | 7                               | | Does not participate in a club | 10                     | 8                               |  If a student from this high school is selected at random, what is the probability that the student participates in a club but does not participate in a sport?
subject: Math

question_text: In a jar, there are 12 green marbles, 8 red marbles, 5 blue marbles, and 15 yellow marbles. If one of these marbles is selected at random, what is the probability of selecting a marble that is neither blue nor yellow?
subject: Math

question_text: A classroom has 25 students. Each student's name is written on a separate piece of paper and placed in a hat. If one piece of paper is selected at random from the hat, what is the probability that the selected piece of paper has the name \
subject: Math

question_text: The students in the Math Club and the Science Club were surveyed about their favorite type of snack. The results are summarized in the table below.  |                        |    | Cookies   Fruit | Total | |------------------------|----|----------------|-------| | Number of Math Club members     |  | 24            | 16    | 40    | | Number of Science Club members |  | 18            | 12    | 30    | | Total                  |  | 42            | 28    | 70    |  Snack Preference of Club Members  If one of the students who prefers Fruit is selected at random, what is the probability the student is in the Science Club?
subject: Math

question_text: At a high school, a survey was conducted among all 450 students to determine their favorite subject among Math, Science, and English. If a student is selected at random, the probability that their favorite subject is Math is 0.32, and the probability that their favorite subject is Science is 0.48. How many students reported English as their favorite subject?
subject: Math

question_text: A bakery produces fresh bagels at a rate of 150 bagels per hour. If the bakery aims to produce 900 bagels in total each morning, what fraction of the 900 bagels produced are made in the first 2 hours of production?
subject: Math

question_text: Daily Visitors to Redwood National Park by Age Group  | Age Group | Number of Visitors | |-----------|--------------------| | 0-9       | 75                 | | 10-19     | 120                | | 20-29     | 185                | | 30-39     | 150                | | 40-49     | 110                | | 50-59     | 90                 | | 60+       | 70                 |  The table above shows the number of visitors to Redwood National Park on a particular day, categorized by age group. Of those visitors who were at least 30 years old, what fraction were at least 50 years old?
subject: Math

question_text: The number of books in a library, sorted by binding type and genre, is shown in the table above. Which genre of book has a hardcover population that is closest to being $\frac{1}{4}$ of the total hardcover book population in the library?
subject: Math

question_text: A bag contains a total of 60 marbles. If 24 of the marbles are yellow, and the rest are green, what is the probability of randomly selecting a green marble? (Express your answer as a decimal or fraction, not as a percent.)
subject: Math

question_text: The table below shows the number of students at a high school who participate in different extracurricular activities and their grade level. A student from this high school is to be chosen at random. If the student chosen is a junior, what is the probability that they participate in the Debate club?  |                  | Debate Club | Math Club |  | |------------------|-------------|-----------|--| | Sophomore        | 20          | 25        |  | | Junior           | 15          | 10        |  | | Senior           | 10          | 30        |  |
subject: Math

2 | 2 | 5 | 4 | 2 | 2 | 5 | 20 | | Total | 5 | 9 | 6 | 5 | 7 | 8 | 40 | The table above shows the number of customer service ratings received by a company during Week 1 and Week 2. Customers rated the service on a scale of 0 to 5, with 5 being the highest rating. Assume each customer provided a rating only once. subject: Math

question_text: A school surveyed students about their favorite subjects and grade level. The table below shows the number of students in each category.  | Grade | Math | English | Science | History | |-------|------|---------|---------|---------| | 11th  | 40   | 35      | 25      | 20      | | 12th  | 30   | 45      | 35      | Y       |  If a 12th-grade student is chosen at random, the probability that the student prefers History is $\frac{1}{6}$. What is the value of Y?
subject: Math

question_text:
A customer feedback survey asked participants to rate their satisfaction with two online shopping websites, Website A and Website B, based on four features. Some participants used Website A, and others used Website B. The table below shows the distribution of preferred features, in percent, for each website.

| Feature                     | Website A | Website B |
|-----------------------------|-----------|-----------|
| Easy Navigation            | 40%       | 25%       |
| Fast Checkout              | 30%       | 40%       |
| Good Product Selection     | 20%       | 25%       |
| Helpful Customer Service | 10%       | 10%       |
| Total                       | 100%      | 100%      |

For the survey, the number of Website B users was three times the number of Website A users. If a person who preferred \
subject: Math

question_text: The Grand Library has a collection of books categorized as Fiction, Non-Fiction, and Children's books. As of October 26, 2023, the library's catalog contained 55,000 books. If a book is selected at random from the library's catalog, the probability that the book is a Fiction book is 0.68. There are $f$ thousand Fiction books in the library. To the nearest integer, what is the value of $f$?
subject: Math

question_text: The table summarizes the distribution of extracurricular activity and grade level for 60 high school students.   |          | Drama Club | Math Club | Science Club | Total | |----------|------------|-----------|--------------|-------| | Grade 9  | 10         | 8         | 2            | 20    | | Grade 10 | 5          | 12        | 3            | 20    | | Grade 11 | 3          | 5         | 12           | 20    | | Total    | 18         | 25        | 17           | 60    |  One of these students will be selected at random. What is the probability of selecting a student who is in Grade 10, given that the student is in Math Club? (Express your answer as a decimal or fraction, not as a percent.)
subject: Math

question_text: The table below shows the distribution of students in a high school according to whether they participate in the Math Club and the Science Club.  | Club Participation            |               |                  | |-----------------------------|---------------|------------------| |                             | In Math Club  | Not in Math Club | | In Science Club              | 25            | 15               | | Not in Science Club           | 10            | 50               |  To the nearest tenth of a percent, what percent of students in the Math Club do not participate in the Science Club?
subject: Math

question_text:
At a local high school, a survey was conducted among students to determine their participation in after-school activities. The survey recorded whether students participated in sports and whether they participated in music clubs. The results are summarized in the table below. | | Participates in Sports | Does not participate
in Sports | Total | |-----------------------------|------------------------|---------------------------------|-------| | Participates in Music Clubs | 75 | 225 | 300 | | Does not participate
in Music Clubs | 125 | 75 | 200 | | Total | 200 | 300 | 500 | If a student who participates in music clubs is selected at random, which of the following is closest to the probability that the student also participates in sports?
subject: Math
